content:
You'll be happy to know that the BRT buses are equipped with power outlets to keep your devices charged during your commute.

**Power Outlets:**

* The BRT buses have a limited number of power outlets, typically located at each seat or in designated areas.
* The outlets are standard 120V, 3-prong outlets, compatible with most laptops and mobile devices.
* Some buses might have USB ports instead of or in addition to power outlets, so it's a good idea to bring a USB-C adapter or a portable power bank as a backup.

**Availability:**

* Power outlets are available on a first-come, first-served basis, so it's a good idea to grab a seat with an outlet as soon as you board the bus.
* Be considerate of your fellow passengers and only use the outlets for charging your devices, not for running high-power appliances like hair dryers or heaters.

**Tips:**

* Bring a portable power bank to top up your devices during the ride, especially if you're concerned about outlet availability.
* Consider investing in a compact, bus-friendly power adapter that can fit snugly into the outlet and won't obstruct the aisle.
* Be mindful of your device's power consumption and try to charge it during less busy parts of the ride to avoid overloading the electrical system.

With power outlets available on the BRT buses, you can stay productive and connected during your commute, and arrive at your destination with a fully charged laptop.
